page.title: 10SHOPS
page.content: In all of our villages there is a Post Office and General Stores. In Butleigh and Baltonsborough there is also a butcher. This contrasts with both villages a hundred years ago. In Butleigh one hundred years ago there was a carpenter, a blacksmith, a co/op with a bakery, two more bakeries, a person who sold alcohol, a shoemaker, a tailor, one butcher, a saddler and a Post Office. Then it was self sufficient but now all major shopping is done outside the village. In Baltonsborough there were seven blacksmiths, seven dressmakers, six shopkeepers including four butchers, five masons, six basketmakers, five washerwomen, two millers, two bakers, three gardeners, three thatchers, a wineseller and a rugman. Nowadays, Baltonsborough is no longer self sufficient.
